Authors: Joseph J. W. Sertich, Mark A. Loewen
Title:
A new basal sauropodomorph dinosaur from the Lower Jurassic
Navajo sandstone of Southern Utah.
Abstract:
Basal sauropodomorphs, or ‘prosauropods,’ are a globally
widespread paraphyletic assemblage of terrestrial herbivorous dinosaurs
from the Late Triassic and Early Jurassic. In contrast to several other
landmasses, the North American record of sauropodomorphs during this
time interval remains sparse, limited to Early Jurassic occurrences of a
single well-known taxon from eastern North America and several
fragmentary specimens from western North America.
